channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: At a Ukraine Maternity Clinic, Deaths From an Airstrike Shatter a Community
item.description: It was one horrific day of the war in Ukraine when a missile fell on the Adonis clinic in Kyiv.

item.title: At a Ukraine Maternity Clinic, Deaths From an Airstrike Shatter a Community
item.description: It was one horrific day of the war in Ukraine when a missile fell on the Adonis clinic in Kyiv.

item.title: Netflix’s Tyson-Paul boxing bout gets 65 million viewers at peak
item.description: More than 100,000 users reported network issues on the Downdetector website throughout the livestreaming of the Paul vs. Tyson fight.

item.title: ‘No Use for Hatred’: A Village Seeks to Move On From a U.S. Massacre
item.description: The hamlet of My Lai is infamous for American war crimes, but now it holds lessons in resilience and how to let go of anger.

item.title: ‘An Absolute Mess’: Brokers Assess the Shift in Fees
item.description: The New York City Council has passed a bill that would require landlords to pay for the rental brokers they hire. Some brokers believe it will hurt te...

item.title: Musk backs Howard Lutnick as Treasury secretary and calls Scott Bessent ‘business-as-usual choice’
item.description: “Business-as-usual is driving America bankrupt, so we need change," Musk said.

item.title: Trump Can Speed Up the Inevitable in Ukraine
item.description: He should force a settlement to save lives and avoid more destruction.

item.title: Boeing issues layoff notices to more than 400 workers as it begins drastic cuts
item.description: Boeing announced in October that it planned to cut 10% of its workforce, about 17,000 jobs, in the coming months.

item.title: Philippines Hit by Typhoon Man-yi
item.description: The storm made landfall late Saturday as a Category 5 storm and was later downgraded.

item.title: Enough
item.description: To suggest we should yield even a little to Trump’s odious politics is unacceptable. Even if we did, it would never be enough.

item.title: China Stabbing Kills at Least 8 People
item.description: The stabbing, in the eastern city of Wuxi, took place days after a man drove a vehicle into a crowd in southern China, killing dozens.

item.title: TikTok parent ByteDance valued at about $300 billion, WSJ says
item.description: A tender offer to employees in October 2023 valued ByteDance at $225 billion, and a December 2023 buyback boosted the valuation to $268 billion.

item.title: Biden and Xi Meet, Delivering Messages Seemingly Intended for Trump
item.description: Donald J. Trump has promised a more aggressive approach, after the Biden administration worked to avoid open conflict with Beijing.

item.title: ‘No Use for Hatred’: A Village Seeks to Move On From a U.S. Massacre
item.description: The hamlet of My Lai is infamous for American war crimes, but now it holds lessons in resilience and how to let go of anger.

item.title: Trump nominates fracking magnate and climate change skeptic as energy secretary
item.description: Trump called Liberty Energy's Chris Wright "one of the pioneers who helped launch the American Shale Revolution."
